I wouldn't put GP in that loop. He's still very counterable.

GP's problem is barrel chaining, being able to shoot a barrel in an area that the enemy can't AA to deny and plop two more down to both clear the wave and do 30%+ of your opponent's health is really stupid.

Barrels either need to not chain the initial damage from the first barrel (so that the damage is lowered, but still respectable) or only take 1 charge off the barrels so you can't plop them down as they're detonating.

40% armour ignore
180 physical damage 
+ the damage that triggered the barrel in an AoE 

lvl 18 - 
200ad GP vs 2000hp champion with 150 armour. 

Barrel + auto attack = 248 damage after resistances (12.5% HP)

How did you get 30%? 
Not only that, but champions who go top tend to have more than 150armour and more than 2k HP.
The only champion that would lose 30% full build vs a full build GP is Adc/support (non-tank)/ mid (without Zonya)

Also before you cry "but GP would have more than 200ad" the result is the same with a 55dmg increase so from 12.5 to 15% HP.  

This is using the stats of a lv18GP with 300ad  vs a top champion 20-25 minutes into the game (stats I used to test damage recieved)

Unless he combined his barrels with Q, he won't be hitting you for more than 25%-30%.
That's pretty low considering most champions will smack that much HP with 1 skill. 

This is the same crap people cried about with the Zed vs Veigar match up and they refused to build Hexdrinker or merc treds. 
All it takes is 1 dead plate or randuin or Zonya, BOOM his barrels only do 10-15% of your HP.

Except Gangplank builds crit, trinity force, and uses parrrrrley. You can't just assume the GP wont use his Q on barrels, cause thats what GP will do.
With just IE, trinity force, and Parrrrrley at level 18, Gp, has 217 AD. If he crits a barrel with parrrrley, that 842.5 + 180 damage with 40% armor pen. With 2000 health and 150 armor, you'd take 538 damage. Which is 26.9% of your health. This is without runes and without masteries. However, with randuins this would be a tad smaller, becoming 485 damage and "only" 24.25% of your health.
Both of which are much closer to 30% than to your 12.5.
Before you start making rude responses, please make sure your math is actually correct and in the context of a realistic situation.
Quick edit: I'm not saying GP is super op, just that your situation is wrong and that the person you responded to is more correct than you are.

I rounded it down to 2k for simplicity purposes.
2700 150 armour is the normal if you pick up boots and 1 defensive item. 

Still 30%? 
It'd also be less bias if you used the same gold value for both attacking and defending items. 
As far as I'm concerned 1 defensive item leaves you with 3k gold roughly after ninja tabi for whatever you want if you hand gank plank those two expensive items. 
Still feel like gangplank is hitting 30%? The defending stats can still be increased by 3k~ gold or used for an offensive item. 

Don't use your Zed dosnt buy Hexdrinker logic here and bring a gangplank with 2items vs unrealistic weaker stats (-200hp and  -HP from defensive item)

Hm, considering the standard lv18 GP build nowadays:

{{item:3078}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3035}} . Usually games end before 6th item, so let's ignore that (6th item is often Sterak's Gauge, Bloodthirster or another IE for GP).

With those items GP have 326 AD (346 with 1 Dragon Buff). As such:

Parrley will deal 469 (489 with Dragon 1) physical damage without a crit.
It will increase to 982 (1034 with Dragon 1) physical damage with a crit.

Trinity Force passive will deal additional 225 physical damage.

Now, assuming that he had a crit and used Parrrley on one of his kegs, it will deal a total of 1396 (1448 with Dragon 1) physical damage, while ignoring 63,3% of all enemies armor and then 20 flat.

In order to deal less than 30% of target's maximum health his target must have 4655 (4826 with Dragon 1) **effective physical health. **

To give you an example of 4826 effective physical health:

3000 health
221 armor (reduced to effective value of 61 against GP)

GP will deal less than 30% of target max health for any target above those values (though, if you plan to build against Gangplank then you should consider getting more health instead). Also, you might need less effective health if you use Reiforced Armor Mastery, Evasive Mastery or Randuin's Omen.

So yes, it's not unrealistic for GP to be dealing more than 30% of enemies max health with single Powder Keg - especially against non-tanks.

PS. I took into account both masteries and runes. Two masteries are worth noting: Double-Edged Sword and Havoc, which increase all your damage by (at least) 5% for melee champions. There is also Executioner, but I didn't use it in this example, since it's conditional.
